Name: Storage
Description: A structure built to store water for a variety of purposes (e.g., water supply, irrigation, pollution control, etc.).

Name: Diversion
Description: A structure built to divert all or some water from a waterway, often into a man-made canal or conduit.

Name: Detention
Description: A structure built for flood control. Retains excess water in a reservoir to maintain the carrying capacity of the waterway, releasing it gradually at a controlled rate to protect downstream areas from flooding.

Name: Saddle
Description: An auxiliary structure constructed at low spots along the perimeter of a reservoir to limit its extent, or to allow for an increase in storage capacity.

Name: Hydro - Closed-cycle pumped storage
Description: A structure that is part of a facility configured to pump water between two water reservoirs at different elevations; both reservoirs are isolated from a free-flowing water source.

Name: Hydro - Conventional storage
Description: A structure that is part of a facility that impounds water, which when released, flows through a turbine and generates electricity.

Name: Hydro - Open-cycle pumped storage
Description: A structure that is part of a facility configured to pump water between two water reservoirs at different elevations; a free-flowing water source is used for either the upper or lower reservoir.

Name: Hydro - Run-of-river
Description: A structure that is part of a facility that channels or syphons water from a water source through an intake and into a canal or penstock to spin a turbine.

Name: Hydro - Tidal
Description: A structure that is part of a facility configured to intake and store water during high tide and slowly release it back into the ocean during low tide.

Name: Hydro - Other
Description: A structure that is part of a facility used to generate hydroelectricity, whose process for generating power is unknown or different than those defined in this table.

Name: Other
Description: The function of the structure is known, but is different from those defined in this table (e.g., debris control or cofferdams). Occasionally, some lateral structures (e.g., canals, embankments, and dikes) may serve a specific function other than those defined in this table and should be assigned a dam function of 'other'.

Name: Unknown
Description: The function of the structure is unknown.
